title: Smith :  It was a great team performance  | Interview | News
body_text:
Olivia Smith was proud of the team effort in our 3-0 win away to OH Leuven in the UEFA Women’s Champions League group phase finale on Wednesday.
Smith provided the opening goal by playing a one-two with Mariona Caldentey and following up on the rebound to a saved effort, before Beth Mead made it 2-0 and a Caitlin Foord cross was turned into the Leuven net by Saar Janssen.
Speaking after the match, Smith said: “I think it was a great team performance. We’re very happy that we got three points and won.
“The chances are always coming so you just have to be ready for it. Playing with Mariona is so fun, I always know what to expect from her. It’s a great present today.”
Asked about our second-biggest away following in the Champions League after last season’s final, Smith added: “It was amazing. It was so motivating and the atmosphere for us was great. I think that gave us more motivation to keep going for more goals.”
It was a big occasion in general, with over 9,000 fans setting a new record for women’s football in Belgium.
“It’s exciting to see where women’s football is going in other countries as well, it’s very positive,” Smith said.
Now, Smith is looking forward to ending the year on a high by trying to get through to the semi-finals of the Subway Women’s League Cup.
“Yeah, 100%. I’m quite sure we will, I think we’re performing really well. Everyone is excited to keep moving forward.”
